element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text:
This algorithm modifies a DEM using a vector layer containing a channel network, so that this channel network matches the one that could be extracted analitically from the modified DEM. This procedure can be used to "force" the DEM to generate a given channel network known in advance.
The process is know as "river burning" and it works lowering the elevation in those cells crossed by the lines in the channel network layer.

element.name: STREAMS
element.text: The channel network to burn onto the DEM

element.name: DEM
element.text: The Digital Elevation Model to modify

element.name: DEPTH
element.text: This parameters indicate the depth (in the same units as the elevation itself in the DEM) of the river burning process. It represents how deep the channel network cell will be excavated below their original elevation.

element.name: RESULT
element.text: The resulting DEM after "burning" the given channel network onto it
